posts.name: Cody Henthorne
posts.cooked:
We’re releasing the Signal 7.47 beta soon. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group here.

Share your feedback on the latest changes:

Mostly work in prep for the Signal Backups Alpha. And changes to hopefully help out those getting the checking for/you may have messages notifications.

Complete list of new commits since 7.46.1:
https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v7.46.1…main

Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.46 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.47.0 (155700)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

27 new commits since 7.46.1:

Show commits

  • Stop STOPPED typing indicator timers on message send. [1]

  • Reset backup restore state after media restoration completes. [2]

    Fixes an issue where the SignalStore.backup.restoreState is never updated from RESTORING_MEDIA after completion of the media restoration.

  • Fix progress bar stuck at 100% after successful backup restore. [3]

  • Add support filter after backup export failure. [4]

  • Prevent backup from being triggered while a restore is in progress. [5]

  • Remove notification state cleanup based on displayed notifications. [6]

  • Only delete archived media from CDN 3. [7]

  • Move restore messages out of durable job. [8]

  • Prevent "Free" tier from being upgraded in the background. [9]

  • Remove launchMode from MainActivity. [10]

  • Fix crash when saving backup key to credential manager on Android 13 and earlier. [11]

  • Add module dependency verification entries to support AS Narwhal stable release. [12]

  • Suppress backup messaging if device is unregistered. [13]

  • Add megaphone to prompt user to enable backups. [14]

  • Add 30 day reminder for manual backups. [15]

  • Do most of the proto and database groundwork for the new mediaName. [16]

  • Validate plaintext hashes for archived attachments. [17]

  • Allow normal attachments to be validated with plaintextHashes. [18]

  • Populate legacy locatorInfo fields. [19]

  • Add the backup alpha build flavor. [20]

  • Remove archive_transfer_file column. [21]

  • Fix archive thumbnail decryption. [22]

  • Try to run IncomingMessageObserver more aggressively. [23]

  • Add link+sync support for the backup4 capability. [24]

  • Update translations and other static files. [25]

  • Update baseline profile. [26]

  • Bump version to 7.47.0 [27]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.46.1…v7.47.0

Localization changes

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: If you try to share an attachment that’s larger than 100MB, it’ll fail to send, then get stuck on the send screen with empty content.

posts.name: Bme13
posts.cooked:
App did not respond when tried to open. Eventually stopped.
https://debuglogs.org/android/7.47.0/2071bc4c45e98fda8838a696342b7ceedf0c27942c05cfcb5bdd7f5ec7b01324

posts.name: Cody Henthorne
posts.cooked:
Whatnoww:

If you try to share an attachment that’s larger than 100MB, it’ll fail to send, then get stuck on the send screen with empty content.

Tracking.

bme13:

App did not respond when tried to open. Eventually stopped.

Fix coming in 7.47.1

New Version: 7.47.1 (155800)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

7 new commits since 7.47.0:

  • Fix deadlock/ANR in IncomingMessageObserver and SignalWebSOcket. [1]

  • Add click handling to choose backup type learn more. [2]

  • Add check for <= 0 time duration for Never case. [3]

  • Bump libsignal to 0.76.0 [4]

  • Add internal tool to reset sender key state. [5]

  • Update translations and other static files. [6]

  • Bump version to 7.47.1 [7]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.47.0…v7.47.1

posts.cooked:
Notification delayed for 6 min.
Message ID 1751005900784
https://debuglogs.org/android/7.47.1/3acd1cdf19dd77a901a6b97c0c957f3bd3cb97f58e1bd367e48e1c78e43ebd79

I am not able to send a message in some groups (or at least in one). It spins forever. It even continues spinning after I have deleted the messages.

I have force stopped Signal and restarted. It doesn’t change.

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.47.1/658620c17912e231209ccf8a50cae5e234a888540e953a0b389a15f4261d2659

posts.name: Cody Henthorne
posts.cooked:
Leibi:

Notification delayed for 6 min.

FCM delivery was delayed 6 minutes Once the system let us know and woke us up we were able to fetch the message.

erik55:

I am not able to send a message in some groups (or at least in one). It spins forever. It even continues spinning after I have deleted the messages.

Logs show you’ve been rate limited for fetching prekeys for users in the group. Eventually they should go through. Is this a group you haven’t sent anything in for awhile? Looks like sending a reaction is jammed up.

I post to this group almost every day.

I have just checked, the last two messages and a reaction were just one day before.

What you say about pre-keys (whatever that is): I just confirmed a request from a new user to join the group before sending my messages. So should I not do that? Better to first send messages and then accept request?

Experiencing the exact same thing. Trying to send a message in a group and it just spins. Delete the message, it continues spinning. Force stopping the app doesn’t seem to do anything.

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.47.1/af1f75058004ace62e6325253baec4f8a2a8a4cc91de3932c238a84a11891380

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
I can no longer send messages in a group. It stays on pending. Same prekey errors.

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.47.1/8609058fa6a4f0133084ac0e9df6d7bb1f825db61d3c10da2539e6f0cbeb07f9

posts.name: sigfun
posts.cooked:
The problem about the screen not turning off during a call persists. One new thing I noticed was that if I received a call on the blocking screen of the phone, it won’t turn off. If then I unblocked the phone while still on the call, it would. However, if I moved the phone again away from my ear to look at the screen such that the proximity sensor “turned off” and then moved it back to my ear to enable the proximity sense again, the screen wouldn’t turn off again, and no matter what I did it wouldn’t again.
This bug has been going for years and it is really problematic as one ends up doing many involuntary interactions in the phone while in a call

Unofficial tools shouldn’t be needed anymore:

Public Signal Backups Testing

We have a rewrite of local backups that uses the new cross-platform backup format that’s almost complete. In addition to using the new cross-platform format, it’s also much smarter about only writing diffs for changed media. This means that creating new backups will be much quicker (seconds instead of minutes), and any external syncing tools you may have set up will be much faster. We’re planning to launch this shortly after the initial backup launch.

That’s from the FAQ in the public cloud backup testing thread:

Public Signal Backups Testing Call for Testing
TL;DR You can test the new Signal Backups feature on Android on our staging servers. Grab the self-updating apk here! Hello, everyone! Many of you are aware that we’ve been working on a new end-to-end encrypted backup system for quite a while. Well, today, we’re finally ready to start testing it with external users The new backup system fulfills so many of the things people have wanted for so long: Hosted by Signal, so your data is safe even if you made a local back…

sigfun:

However, if I moved the phone away from my ear to look at the screen such that the proximity sensor “turned off” and then movedit back to my rear the screen wouldn’t turn off again

Ear to the rear?! Signal is not designed for that

In a 1:1 chat, an image was fully uploaded according to the progress indicator, but it appeared to not be sent. When I left the chat and opened it again, the progress indicator was gone.

Message ID

1751132113635

Log

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.47.1/08d8e118703942dbf7f6845fb810158a2a783e813995d4ca7966cd22aed686d2

cody-signal:

FCM delivery was delayed 6 minutes Once the system let us know and woke us up we were able to fetch the message.

I think this is a bug with doze. I filed a ticket for it here: Google Issue Tracker

posts.name: Hugo
posts.cooked:
Not sure if this is intended, but I am noticing notifications are being shown when a message is edited, while I’m in the same conversation, logs:
https://debuglogs.org/android/7.47.1/49ca26c1ade59ed112470605386464efa5c8ab8df8f846781954bcaa5efdbcfc

Message ID: 1751205241153

posts.name: fr33tux
posts.cooked:
I got a memory corruption crash caught by MTE when processing a few videos (before the upload step) on a bad network: Pasthis - Simple pastebin
It was not a one time, it was crashing in the background too as Signal kept retrying.

I exported the Signal debug logfile, I can share it in DM if it’s helpful.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
Well… Safe to say group sending never recovered.

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.47.1/82fbd27ff6b1791c55ae9e7ccfbbfbde7cf88656f87e69f85e8fbad6b079c150
